channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Trump threatens to call in troops but unrest goes on
Some in Pentagon increasingly wary as Trump pushes military response
'I am outraged': Bishop overseeing church responds to Trump photo-op
item.description: Bishop Mariann Edgar Budde, who oversees St. John's Episcopal Church in Washington DC, responds to President Trump's photo-op at the church shortly after his remarks about the protests over the death of George Floyd.

item.title: As America sees another night of protests and curfews, families of those killed plea for no more violence
3 generations share their truth about being black in America
Three videos piece together the final moments of George Floyd's life
Two-thirds of people put in neck restraints by Minneapolis police were black, department data shows
item.description: In the years leading up to George Floyd's death with his neck beneath the knee of a Minneapolis policeman, at least 58 people lost consciousness after the city's officers put them in neck restraints, according to a CNN analysis of use of force data from the police department.

item.title: Police chief to Trump: Please, keep your mouth shut if you can't be constructive
item.description: Houston police chief Art Acevedo responds to President Trump telling governors to "dominate" protesters.

item.title: A rare wave of public dissent from Facebook employees
item.description: In a rare example of public dissent, some Facebook employees are taking to Twitter to express strong disagreements with CEO Mark Zuckerberg's decision not to take any action on a series of controversial posts last week from President Donald Trump, including an apparent threat that "looting" would lead to "shooting."

item.title: New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern fears protesters are risking another outbreak
Boris Johnson's Brexit nightmare is back at the worst possible moment
item.description: June 2020 is set to be one of the most important months in Boris Johnson's somewhat tumultuous first year as Prime Minister.

item.title: The sixth mass extinction is happening faster than expected, and it's our fault
item.description: The sixth mass extinction is not a worry for the future. It's happening now, much faster than previously expected, and it's entirely our fault, according to a study published Monday.

item.title: Five dead in newest Ebola outbreak in Congo, UNICEF says
item.description: Five people, including a 15-year-old girl, have died of Ebola in a fresh outbreak of the virus in the Democratic Republic of Congo, the United Nations Children's Fund said Monday. Nine cases total have been reported, UNICEF said.

item.title: India is using drones and fire trucks to fight its worst locust invasion in almost 30 years
item.description: As India continues its battle with the coronavirus pandemic a new kind of invasion is threatening to destroy vital crops and vegetation -- the worst locust swarm the country has seen in almost 30 years.

item.title: Anderson Cooper calls out Trump: 'Who's the thug here?'
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper reacts to President Trump's recent threats to mobilize the US military to end riots over George Floyd's death and his subsequent photo opportunituy at St. John's Episcopal Church.

item.title: Fauci hasn't spoken with Trump in two weeks
item.description: Dr. Anthony Fauci, one of the most prominent members of the White House coronavirus task force, said on Monday that he has not spoken to or met with President Donald Trump in two weeks.

item.title: Should you fly yet? Here's what an epidemiologist and an exposure scientist say
item.description: We don't know about you, but we're ready to travel. And that typically means flying.

item.title: Emirates restarts flights but the flying experience won't be the same
item.description: Emirates restarted regular passenger flights with very new measures in place. CNN's John Defterios speaks to the passengers and the crew adjusting to this new normal in air travel.

item.title: Chinese gaming company seeks nearly $3 billion in Hong Kong listing
item.description: NetEase is set to make its Hong Kong stock market debut next week, as tensions between the United States and China intensify.

item.title: Moderna set off a frenzy with its vaccine trial. Some are calling for an investigation
item.description: Moderna set off a frenzy on Wall Street earlier this month when it announced positive, preliminary results from its coronavirus vaccine trial. As the hype grew, the young biotech company and its leading investor wasted no time capitalizing on the briefly surging stock price.

item.title: Trump is gift-wrapping a propanganda win for China
Social distancing and masks do reduce risk of getting Covid-19, major review finds
item.description: Stay 6 feet apart and, while you're at it, wear a face covering. While most countries around the world have instituted simple steps like these to help stop the spread of Covid-19, the scientific evidence behind them hasn't always been clear-cut and has, in the case of masks, sometimes been contradictory.

item.title: Cuomo reacts to Trump holding Bible for photo-op: Open it!
item.description: CNN's Chris Cuomo says President Donald Trump doesn't acknowledge that the nation is in pain because Trump is only looking out for himself.

item.title: Carole Baskin awarded the zoo once owned by 'Tiger King' Joe Exotic
item.description: Carole Baskin, whose longstanding feud with Joe Exotic was chronicled in the hit Netflix docuseries "Tiger King," has been awarded the zoo once owned by her nemesis.

item.title: Police march with protesters in act of solidarity
item.description: Why are police getting down on their knees with protesters? CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

item.title: Music industry leaders vow to pause business for a day in observation of Blackout Tuesday
item.description: The show will be paused. At least, that's the message coming from leaders and artists in the music business as part of a movement being referred to as Blackout Tuesday.

item.title: DOJ hits brakes on police investigations, experts say
item.description: During the Obama administration, high-profile police shootings of black men like Michael Brown in Ferguson, Missouri and Laquan McDonald in Chicago helped spark sweeping federal investigations and reforms of biased policing practices.

item.title: Thousands around the world protest George Floyd's death in global display of solidarity
item.description: Protesters have marched in the US for six consecutive nights over the death of George Floyd at the hands of a police officer. Their anger over the killing of the unarmed black man has now spread worldwide.

item.title: How the world is responding to George Floyd's death
item.description: From Auckland, New Zealand to Rio de Janeiro, Brazil to Berlin, Germany, protesters around the world took to the streets to show solidarity with demonstrators in the US over the death of George Floyd while in police custody. CNN's Nic Robertson reports.

item.title: Biden's in one of the best positions for any challenger since scientific polling began
The homes frozen in time on an abandoned Hong Kong island
item.description: While many visitors to Hong Kong know about the main Hong Kong island, home to many of the financial capital's skyscrapers, the city is actually an archipelago.

item.title: World-famous beach emptied by coronavirus
item.description: Miguel Oliveira firmly pushes down on the limes and sugar in the cocktail shaker, for the first time that day. It's noon, and this, together with the sparsely-populated promenade his kiosk bar sits on, is just one sign that something is wrong in Rio de Janeiro.

item.title: Sheriff takes off riot gear and joins protesters
item.description: Genesee County Sheriff Chris Swanson spoke with demonstrators who were met by police officers in riot gear and then joined the protest, according to CNN affiliate WEYI.

item.title: George Floyd's last words fly across the skies
item.description: The final words of George Floyd, the African American man who died after being restrained by a Minneapolis police officer, have become powerful slogans for protesters in the US.

item.title: Prayer book once owned by tragic queen to be sold at auction for up to $434,000
item.description: A prayer book that once belonged to Mary, Queen of Scots and contains an inscription by the tragic monarch is to go on sale, with an expected price of up to £350,000 ($432,000).

item.title: Gourmet home delivery is here to stay in Dubai
item.description: Many restaurants around the world have relied on takeout to stay in business while under lockdown. But in a city known for its fine dining, some of Dubai's top eateries are making gourmet home delivery a regular offering.

item.title: John Legend says his friendship with Kanye West has evolved
item.description: John Legend and Kanye West are in "different places," according to the singer.

item.title: Fox Sports anchor apologizes for 'completely inappropriate' Adolf Hitler joke
item.description: Fox Sports anchor Matty Johns has apologized for a "completely inappropriate" joke after a TV segment featuring a photoshopped cardboard cutout of Adolf Hitler was aired on one of the broadcaster's Australian National Rugby League shows.

item.title: First sighting of Queen Elizabeth, 94, during lockdown -- and she's on a horse
item.description: Britain's Queen Elizabeth II has been pictured riding on horseback in Windsor, west of London, in her first public appearance since the coronavirus lockdown began in the UK.

item.title: What nudists do during a lockdown
item.description: On an average weekday, you might find Parisian Laurent Luft enjoying a swim at the city's Roger Le Gall swim center.

item.title: 'My emotions were so raw': The people creating art to remember George Floyd
item.description: In the wake of George Floyd's death at the hands of a Minneapolis police officer, artists have been quick to respond with works that seek to memorialize, to provoke and to heal.

item.title: How to talk to your children about protests and racism
item.description: As cities and social media explode with anger over the killing of yet another black man at the hands of police, worried parents struggle with how to protect their children from seeing the worst of the violence while simultaneously explaining the ravages of racism.

item.title: 40 Years of CNN
item.description: On June 1, 1980, the Cable News Network hit the airwaves for the first time. 40 years later, look back at the most memorable stories CNN has covered around the globe.

item.title: Looting continued in New York, military helicopters attempted to dispel protesters in DC and at least 4 officers in Missouri were hit by gunfire during protests
Pentagon concerned over Trump's threat to use troops
item.description: Defense officials tell CNN there was deep and growing discomfort among some in the Pentagon even before President Donald Trump announced Monday that he is ready to deploy the military to enforce order inside the United States.

item.title: Analysis: Trump's made-for-TV strongman act threatens traditions
item.description: President Donald Trump's made-for-TV embrace of authoritarianism's imagery and tools at a brittle national moment risks unleashing toxic political forces that threaten America's democratic traditions.

item.title: Opinion: Trump's American dystopia reaches ominous cliff
item.description: With the sound of flash bang explosions and tear gas being fired in the background, President Donald Trump spoke the words of a tyrant Monday, delivered from a teleprompter in the Rose Garden, vowing to use military force -- as he was doing at that very moment to peaceful demonstrators -- to put down protests across the country touched off after the death of a Black man, George Floyd, in police custody in Minneapolis.

item.title: Peaceful protesters near White House gassed, shot with rubber bullets as Trump leaves for church photo-op
item.description: • Watch: Bishop on photo-op: I'm outraged • Watch: Military vehicles move near WH • Can Trump legally deploy troops to US cities?

item.title: White supremacists pose as Antifa online, call for violence
item.description: A Twitter account that tweeted a call to violence and claimed to be representing the position of "Antifa" was in fact created by a known white supremacist group, Twitter said Monday. The company removed the account.

item.title: Floyd's family calls for calm as protesters undeterred by curfews
item.description: Hours after George Floyd's brother asked protesters to abstain from violence, the Minneapolis site where Floyd died last week was being treated as a sacred memorial.
